service-versions.name: Riverbed Stingray Traffic Manager 9.0
service-versions.description: Reliability and scalability: Increase application reliability by load balancing traffic across web and application servers, balancing load across multiple data centers (private or public clouds), monitoring the response time of servers in real-time to decide the fastest way to deliver a service, protecting against traffic surges, and by managing the bandwidth and rate of requests used by different classes of traffic.

service.name: Riverbed Stingray Traffic Manager 9.0
service.description: Stingray is all software that can be seamlessly deployed in private, public, and hybrid clouds Scale application servers by up to 3x by offloading TCP and SSL connection overhead Accelerate applications by up to 4x by using web content optimization (WCO)

ns9:component-version-script.script:
#!/bin/bash # Copyright (c) 2012 Riverbed Technology, Inc. All rights reserved. # INPUTS: OPT_CLUSTER_HOST, OPT_CLUSTER_PORT, STINGRAY_ADMIN_PASSWORD # Find the key, if it was installed by a preconfigure script set -x export PATH=$PATH:/usr/local/sbin:/usr/local/bin:/usr/sbin:/usr/bin:/sbin:/bin set -e if [ ${UID} != "0" ]; then echo "Setup needs to be run as root - exiting" exit 1 fi
# Generate an admin password for I in {1..8}; do echo $RANDOM >> /tmp/passwd done MD5=$(md5sum /tmp/passwd) ZEUS_ADMIN_PASSWORD=${MD5:1:8} STINGRAY_ADMIN_PASSWORD=$ZEUS_ADMIN_PASSWORD if [ -f /tmp/$Stingray_License_File ] ; then LICENSE_PATH="/tmp/$Stingray_License_File" else LICENSE_PATH= fi
# First try to join an existing cluster, but if that fails create a new cluster if [ -n "$OPT_CLUSTER_HOST" ] ; then if [ -n "$OPT_CLUSTER_PORT" ] ; then OPT_CLUSTER_PORT=9090 fi cat > /tmp/stm-configure-record <<EOF accept-license=accept start_at_boot=Y net!warn= zlb!admin_hostname=$OPT_CLUSTER_HOST zlb!admin_password=$STINGRAY_ADMIN_PASSWORD zlb!admin_port=$OPT_CLUSTER_PORT zlb!admin_username=admin zxtm!cluster=s zxtm!clustertipjoin=Y zxtm!group= zxtm!license_key=$LICENSE_PATH zxtm!use_invalid_key_license=y zxtm!unique_bind=N zxtm!user= zxtm!fingerprints_ok=y EOF
/usr/local/zeus/zxtm/configure --noninteractive --replay-from=/tmp/stm-configure-record 2>&1 | tee /tmp/stm-configure.log # If the cluster joining failed for any reason except that we couldn't contact # the cluster_host, then we should give up and strand the instance # This means that the first node in an auto-scaled array will create a new # cluster, but subsequent nodes should join that cluster CONFIG_SUCCESSFUL=${PIPESTATUS[0]} grep "ERROR: Cannot connect to remote host" /tmp/stm-configure.log > /dev/null CONNECT_FAILED=$? if [ $CONFIG_SUCCESSFUL -eq 0 ] ; then exit 0 else if [ $CONNECT_FAILED -ne 0 ] ; then echo Failed to join cluster, exiting exit 1 else echo Could not contact cluster host $OPT_CLUSTER_HOST fi fi fi # If cluster_host was not specified, or we could not contact it (indicating that # we are the first node in a new auto-scaling array) then set up as a new stand-alone # cluster echo Creating a new cluster cat > /tmp/stm-configure-record <<EOF accept-license=accept admin!password=$ZEUS_ADMIN_PASSWORD net!warn= start_at_boot=Y zxtm!cluster=C zxtm!group= zxtm!license_key=$LICENSE_PATH zxtm!use_invalid_key_license=y zxtm!unique_bind=N zxtm!user= EOF
cat /tmp/stm-configure-record echo "###############"
/usr/local/zeus/zxtm/configure --noninteractive --replay-from=/tmp/stm-configure-record 2>&1 | tee /tmp/stm-configure.log echo Your Stingray Traffic Manager administrator credentials have been set to username \"admin\" with password \"$ZEUS_ADMIN_PASSWORD\". echo You should change this password in the STM Graphical User Interface as soon as possible. This temporary password is stored in /root/admin_password for reference. echo echo touch /root/.firstrun
#Change the Admin port sed -i 's/9090/8080/g' /usr/local/zeus/admin/website /usr/local/zeus/restart-zeus
################################################################################################################################# #Stingray Traffic Manager Configuration
if [ $Stingray_SSL_Offload_Enable = yes ]; then Stingray_VS_Port=443 Stingray_Create_Cert=$(cat <<EOF Catalog.SSL.Certificates.createSelfSignedCertificate $Stingray_VS_Name_Cert {key_size:1024, subject:{common_name:"app.foo.com",organisation:"Foo.Inc",location:"San Francisco",state:"CA",country:"US"}, valid_days:365 } EOF ) Stingray_VS_Cert="VirtualServer.setSSLCertificate $Stingray_VS_Name $Stingray_VS_Name_Cert" Stingray_VS_SSL_Enable="VirtualServer.setSSLDecrypt $Stingray_VS_Name 1" else Stingray_VS_Port=80 fi
#Base Configuration /usr/local/zeus/zxtm/bin/zcli <<EOF GlobalSettings.setJavaEnabled 0 Catalog.Persistence.addPersistence Jsession Catalog.Persistence.setType Jsession $Stingray_Persistence_Method Catalog.Monitor.copyMonitors "Full HTTP" $Stingray_Pool_Monitor Catalog.Monitor.setPath $Stingray_Pool_Monitor $Stingray_Monitor_URL Catalog.Monitor.setStatusRegex $Stingray_Pool_Monitor ^200$ Pool.addPool $Stingray_Pool "${Stingray_Node_IPs[0]}:$Stingray_Node_Port" Pool.setPersistence $Stingray_Pool Jsession Pool.setMonitors $Stingray_Pool $Stingray_Pool_Monitor VirtualServer.addVirtualServer $Stingray_VS_Name { port:$Stingray_VS_Port, protocol: http, default_pool: $Stingray_Pool } VirtualServer.setEnabled $Stingray_VS_Name 1 $Stingray_Create_Cert $Stingray_VS_Cert $Stingray_VS_SSL_Enable EOF
#Add Nodes to the pool for (( i = 1 ; i < ${#Stingray_Node_IPs[@]} ; i++ )); do /usr/local/zeus/zxtm/bin/zcli <<EOF pool.addNodes $Stingray_Pool ["${Stingray_Node_IPs[$i]}:$Stingray_Node_Port"] EOF done
###############################################################################################################################################

meta-tag-type.name: OS Family
meta-tag-type.description: Operating System (OS) Family.

ns9:component-version-script.script:
#!/bin/bash
# Copyright (c) 2011, Riverbed Technology, Inc. All rights reserved. # Inputs... # REPO_URL: The URL of the repository from which to download the Stingray binary distribution. # STINGRAY_PKG_NAME: The name of the binary package to download. # UID=`/usr/bin/id | cut -f2 -d"=" | cut -f1 -d"("`
set -x
export PATH=$PATH:/usr/local/sbin:/usr/local/bin:/usr/sbin:/usr/bin:/sbin:/bin set -e
if [ ${UID} != "0" ]; then echo "Setup needs to be run as root - exiting" exit 1 fi REPO_URL=$Stingray_Download_URL STINGRAY_PKG_NAME="ZeusTM_93_Linux" STINGRAY_PKG_DIRNAME="ZeusTM_93_Linux-x86" STINGRAY_LICENSE=$Stingray_License_File if [ STINGRAY_PKG_NAME = .. ] ; then STINGRAY_PKG_NAME=.Zeus_81_Linux. fi cd /tmp # Download the neeeded license file if [ ! -z $STINGRAY_LICENSE ]; then echo "wget -o dl_lic.log ${REPO_URL}${STINGRAY_LICENSE}" wget -o dl_lic.log ${REPO_URL}${STINGRAY_LICENSE} fi # Download and unpack the attached Traffic Manager package ARCH=`uname -m` if [ x$ARCH = "xx86_64" ] ; then wget -o dl.log ${REPO_URL}${STINGRAY_PKG_NAME}-x86.tgz tar zxvf ${STINGRAY_PKG_NAME}-x86.tgz cd ${STINGRAY_PKG_DIRNAME} else wget -o dl.log ${REPO_URL}-x86.tgz tar zxvf ${STINGRAY_PKG_NAME}-x86.tgz cd ${STINGRAY_PKG_DIRNAME} fi # Install the software, but don't configure it. cat > /tmp/ztm-install-record <<EOF accept-license=accept zeushome=/usr/local/zeus zxtm!perform_initial_config=N EOF ./zinstall --replay-from=/tmp/ztm-install-record

meta-tag-type.name: OS Family
meta-tag-type.description: Operating System (OS) Family.
